blog.name: the-wandering-criminal
blog.title: “Although I Wander, I Will Return”
blog.description: Just your local Crime Mama🍎Writing🍎Aesthetics🍎Headcanons🍎Problematic Content🍎 Be Gay & Do Crime

summary: how about little my playing a prank on snufkin?
question: how about little my playing a prank on snufkin?
answer:
“Moominmamma!”


Moominmamma looked up just in time for Little My to crash into her legs. “Oh my!” She cried, reaching down to pat the Mymble on the shoulder. “What’s the rush, Little My?” She asked, a familiar feeling surfacing in the back of her head that came with being a parent. Little My giggled and looked up at Moominmamma with her signature grin. “Oh nothing, Moominmamma,” she replied. Moominmamma arched a brow, completely skeptical. Just as she opened her mouth to interrogate the Mymble further the door burst open with a vengeance.


“You little wretch!” Snufkin growled, face flushed with anger. Moominmamma’s eyes widened as she saw the young mumrik’s attire. Instead of the usual green it was a bright pink and his hat was a mess of mismatch flowers and twigs. Little My giggled and Moominmamma sighed in exasperation.


Snufkin shook his fist at his sister. “Oh! You little rat just wait until I get my hands on you!”


Little My stuck her tongue out at him. “Just try it ya scrub!” Snufkin growled and ran towards Little My who squealed in excitement and took off running out the house. Snufkin followed, shouting quite colorful language.


Moominmamma shook her head and chuckled to herself. Well, at least the day was never dull in her household.

blog.name: thefearisoneself
blog.title: You know. Me, Chad of Camelot.
blog.description: Hello! Please call me Jir! While I reblog lots of things my art is all under my Moominvalley tag, please check it out! I'm a 21 year old girl with High functioning Autism from Canada. My current biggest fandom is Moomins with my favourite character being Snufkin. I am also a fan of Wander over Yonder, Star vs the Forces of Evil, Steven Universe, Ducktales, Undertale, Gravity Falls, the Adventure Zone, OK KO and We Bare Bears. If you have any questions or just want to tell me something, go right ahead, don't be afraid to ask! Just please nothing rude.

summary:
Trying to draw Mymble girls, I drew young Mymble and The Mymbles daughter. 
Their flat to the head onion hair never looks right...
body:
Trying to draw Mymble girls, I drew young Mymble and The Mymbles daughter.

Their flat to the head onion hair never looks right in my style so I gave them each varying types of bangs.

Young Mymble’s are a bit wavier, Mymble’s daughter’s are straight and Little My’s are frayed!

blog.name: the-wandering-criminal
blog.title: “Although I Wander, I Will Return”
blog.description: Just your local Crime Mama🍎Writing🍎Aesthetics🍎Headcanons🍎Problematic Content🍎 Be Gay & Do Crime

summary: Invisible snufkin but moomin helps him appear again
question: Invisible snufkin but moomin helps him appear again
answer:
Moomin toyed with his tail, wringing it nervously as he watched Snufkin sit on the porch. He was smoking again, Moomin could tell. The smell of tobacco strong as ever and the smoke curling around Snukin like a veil.


Moomin sighed quietly, sadly. The young mumrik was still invisible, unfortunately. He was silent too and often kept to himself. Moomin often wondered if he and his family were truly helping the wandering traveler. Every night, he hoped and he prayed that his doubts and fears were wrong. That Snukin would become visible once more.


“Moomin?”


The Moomintroll jumped, hands tightening on his tail. “Ah! H-hello, Snukin!” He cried, throughly embarrassed. Snufkin tilted his head, or that’s what it looked like if the angle of his hat was anything to go by, and lowered his pipe. “Are you alright?” He asked. Are you alright, Moomin wanted to ask. Are we helping? Do you know you can rely on us?


But instead he smiled. “Of course! Would you like some company?”


Snufkin was silent for a moment. A part of Moomin hoped he would say yes. He didn’t want to leave Snufkin alone.


“Sure.”


Moomin blinked in surprise. “Really?”


Snufkin let out a small laugh. “Of course, my friend.” Moomin smiled softly and settled himself next to Snufkin. The mumrik took another puff of his pipe and Moomin sat silently, unwilling to ruin this quiet moment between them. The silence stretched for a while until Snufkin sighed and finally spoke.


“You must be ashamed of me.”


Moomin blinked. “What? Why would you say that?”


Snufkin fell silent. Moomin furrowed his brows at the strange mumrik, unsure of where these self-deprecating thoughts were coming from. Snufkin sat his pipe down and hung his head low. “Because I wasn’t strong enough,” he whispered, the pain in his voice making Moomin tear up. The Moomintroll sniffled before grabbing his friend’s hand firmly.


“I want you to know,” he began, yet unsure of where he was going with this, “that you are strong. You’re amazing yet so aggravating with your schemes and ideas but that’s what makes you you. I love you Snukin and I want you to know I’m here. That we’re all here,” Moomin’s voice cracked at the end and he furiously wiped is eyes. This was not the time to be such a cry baby!


A soft hand grazed his cheek and he jumped. “Snufkin?” He whispered, seeing the faint appearance of his friend’s body. He could see him. He could see him. It was faint but dammit it was there.


Snufkin smiled with teary brown eyes. “Thank you, Moomintroll. Thank you.”

Snufkin let out a small laugh. “Of course, my friend.” Moomin smiled softly and settled himself next to Snufkin. The mumrik took another puff of his pipe and Moomin sat silently, unwilling to ruin this quiet moment between them. The silence stretched for a while until Snufkin sighed and finally spoke.


“You must be ashamed of me.”


Moomin blinked. “What? Why would you say that?”


Snufkin fell silent. Moomin furrowed his brows at the strange mumrik, unsure of where these self-deprecating thoughts were coming from. Snufkin sat his pipe down and hung his head low. “Because I wasn’t strong enough,” he whispered, the pain in his voice making Moomin tear up. The Moomintroll sniffled before grabbing his friend’s hand firmly.


“I want you to know,” he began, yet unsure of where he was going with this, “that you are strong. You’re amazing yet so aggravating with your schemes and ideas but that’s what makes you you. I love you Snukin and I want you to know I’m here. That we’re all here,” Moomin’s voice cracked at the end and he furiously wiped is eyes. This was not the time to be such a cry baby!


A soft hand grazed his cheek and he jumped. “Snufkin?” He whispered, seeing the faint appearance of his friend’s body. He could see him. He could see him. It was faint but dammit it was there.


Snufkin smiled with teary brown eyes. “Thank you, Moomintroll. Thank you.”
trail.content:
Moomin toyed with his tail, wringing it nervously as he watched Snufkin sit on the porch. He was smoking again, Moomin could tell. The smell of tobacco strong as ever and the smoke curling around Snukin like a veil.


Moomin sighed quietly, sadly. The young mumrik was still invisible, unfortunately. He was silent too and often kept to himself. Moomin often wondered if he and his family were truly helping the wandering traveler. Every night, he hoped and he prayed that his doubts and fears were wrong. That Snukin would become visible once more.


“Moomin?”


The Moomintroll jumped, hands tightening on his tail. “Ah! H-hello, Snukin!” He cried, throughly embarrassed. Snufkin tilted his head, or that’s what it looked like if the angle of his hat was anything to go by, and lowered his pipe. “Are you alright?” He asked. Are you alright, Moomin wanted to ask. Are we helping? Do you know you can rely on us?


But instead he smiled. “Of course! Would you like some company?”


Snufkin was silent for a moment. A part of Moomin hoped he would say yes. He didn’t want to leave Snufkin alone.


“Sure.”


Moomin blinked in surprise. “Really?”


Snufkin let out a small laugh. “Of course, my friend.” Moomin smiled softly and settled himself next to Snufkin. The mumrik took another puff of his pipe and Moomin sat silently, unwilling to ruin this quiet moment between them. The silence stretched for a while until Snufkin sighed and finally spoke.


“You must be ashamed of me.”


Moomin blinked. “What? Why would you say that?”


Snufkin fell silent. Moomin furrowed his brows at the strange mumrik, unsure of where these self-deprecating thoughts were coming from. Snufkin sat his pipe down and hung his head low. “Because I wasn’t strong enough,” he whispered, the pain in his voice making Moomin tear up. The Moomintroll sniffled before grabbing his friend’s hand firmly.


“I want you to know,” he began, yet unsure of where he was going with this, “that you are strong. You’re amazing yet so aggravating with your schemes and ideas but that’s what makes you you. I love you Snukin and I want you to know I’m here. That we’re all here,” Moomin’s voice cracked at the end and he furiously wiped is eyes. This was not the time to be such a cry baby!


A soft hand grazed his cheek and he jumped. “Snufkin?” He whispered, seeing the faint appearance of his friend’s body. He could see him. He could see him. It was faint but dammit it was there.


Snufkin smiled with teary brown eyes. “Thank you, Moomintroll. Thank you.”
